characters.name: Earth Crystal Pony royal guards
characters.description: royal guards, some also referred to as the E.U.P. (Earth, Unicorn, Pegasus) Guard of the Protective Pony Platoons, are various groups of armored ponies, griffons, Hippogriffs, or gargoyles that serve various members of royalty. They act as bodyguards, ceremonial guards in festivities, soldiers, and chauffeurs on several occasions. The guards are generally shown wearing extremely serious expressions and usually don't speak, but when they do, their voice is provided by Jayson Thiessen, Andrew Francis, Peter New, Ian Hanlin, Brian Drummond, Jason Simpson and/or Scott Underwood. Their cutie marks are obscured by their uniforms.

characters.name:
Lavender Crystal Pony
Amber Laurel
characters.description: Appears in The Crystalling - Part 1 and The Crystalling - Part 2 as a witness to Flurry Heart's Crystalling. Has speaking roles in The Crystalling - Part 1 and The Times They Are A Changeling, voiced by Andrea Libman in both. Also appears in A Royal Problem, Uncommon Bond, The Parent Map, and The Beginning of the End - Part 1. Her cutie mark is an ornamental flowerpot. She is a character called "Lavender Crystal Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Amberlocks
characters.description: A Crystal Pony who appears in the Crystal Empire in The Crystal Empire - Part 2 and Games Ponies Play and in Canterlot in Magical Mystery Cure. Her cutie mark is a grain of wheat.

characters.name:
Plum Crystal Pony
Amethyst Shard
characters.description: Appears in The Crystalling - Part 1 and The Crystalling - Part 2 as a witness to Flurry Heart's Crystalling. Also appears in The Times They Are A Changeling, It Isn't the Mane Thing About You, Uncommon Bond, and The Beginning of the End - Part 1. Her cutie mark is three purple wheel-shaped objects. She is a character called "Plum Crystal Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Arctic Lily
characters.description: A Crystal Pony who appears in The Crystal Empire - Part 2. She also appears in a photograph in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 5. Her cutie mark is a fleur-de-lis.

characters.name: Autumn Gem
characters.description: Autumn Gem, also called Sapphire Joy or Jewel Joy, is a female Crystal Earth pony with a light blue coat, bright pink and purple mane and tail, deep blue eyes, and a cutie mark usually of a plant growth. She has a speaking role in the two-part season three premiere. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named varyingly in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Berry Splash
characters.description: A Crystal Pony athlete who appears in Games Ponies Play.

characters.name: Bright Smile
characters.description: Bright Smile is a Crystal Earth pony stallion with a bright teal coat, golden mane and tail, gold eyes, and a cutie mark of a crenelated tower. He has a speaking role in the episodes The Crystal Empire - Part 2 and Equestria Games and in the magazine comic The Quest for the Lost Toy! He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name:
Mail Pony
Brilliant Service
characters.description: Appears in The Parent Map as a Crystal Empire mail carrier. His cutie mark is a red ribbon. He is a character called "Crystal Mailpony" in Gameloft's mobile game; his bio states, "Neither snow nor sleet nor Sombra can keep him from his appointed rounds! Well, maybe that last one can." Voiced by Andrew McNee.

characters.name: Check Mate
characters.description: A Crystal Pony who appears in The Crystal Empire - Part 2. He also appears in a photograph in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 5. His cutie mark is a crenelated tower.

characters.name: Crystal Beau
characters.description: Crystal Beau is a Crystal Earth pony stallion with a light teal coat, deep teal mane and tail, purple eyes, and a cutie mark of a bow and arrow. He has a speaking role in The Crystal Empire - Part 2. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise.

characters.name: Crystal Hoof
characters.description: Disguise used by Thorax in The Times They Are A Changeling.

characters.name: Crystal Varado
characters.description: A Crystal Pony who appears in Equestria Games, fanning Spike. Also appears in The Crystalling - Part 1, The Crystalling - Part 2, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 9.

characters.name: Dandy Brush
characters.description: One of the stylist Crystal Ponies who appear in Games Ponies Play. Also appears in the season 3 poster. Her cutie mark is a brush.

characters.name: Elbow Grease
characters.description: Elbow Grease is a Crystal Earth pony mare with a pink coat, pale light and light blue mane and tail, bright teal eyes, and a cutie mark usually of a fleur-de-lis. She has a speaking role in the episodes The Crystal Empire - Part 1 and Equestria Games. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Esmeralda
characters.description: A Crystal Pony who appears in The Crystal Empire - Part 2. Her cutie mark is a fleur-de-lis.

characters.name:
Cream Crystal Pony
Fleur De Verre
characters.description: Fleur De Verre is a Crystal Earth pony mare with a cream-colored coat, pink mane and tail, purple eyes, and a cutie mark of a fleur-de-lis. She has a speaking role in the episodes The Crystal Empire - Part 1, Trade Ya!, and A Royal Problem. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise.

characters.name:
Indigo Crystal Pony
Gallic
characters.description: Appears in The Crystalling - Part 1 and The Crystalling - Part 2 as a witness to Flurry Heart's Crystalling. Also appears in The Times They Are A Changeling, A Royal Problem, Uncommon Bond, The Parent Map, The Beginning of the End - Part 1, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 9. His cutie mark is a royal guard helmet. He is a character called "Indigo Crystal Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Golden Glitter
characters.description: One of the stylist Crystal Ponies who appear in Games Ponies Play. Also appears in The Times They Are A Changeling, It Isn't the Mane Thing About You, and the season 3 poster. Her cutie mark is a crown. She is named in the twenty-second wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards. The collector card states about Golden Glitter, "She throws parties for her friends."

characters.name: Golden Hooves
characters.description: A messenger Crystal Pony who appears in Games Ponies Play. Also appears in The Crystalling - Part 1, The Crystalling - Part 2, The Beginning of the End - Part 1, Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 9, and the season 3 poster. She resembles Lemon Hearts in color scheme. She is named "Golden Hooves" in the twenty-second wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards. The collector card states about Golden Hooves, "She delivers good news to friends." Her cutie mark in the show is a grain of wheat and on the toy is a winged lightning bolt. Voiced by Cathy Weseluck. She was first named "Mercury" on her Enterplay collectible card game The Crystal Games expansion set card #40 U, which gives her the description "Fast on her hooves and with a detailed memory of every street corner and business around, there is no better messenger pony in the Crystal Empire than Mercury!" She is a character named "Mercury" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "This messenger ponyâ€™s speed just canâ€™t be beat. You need a delivery? Sheâ€™ll see it complete!"

characters.name:
Orange Crystal Pony
Golden VÃ¤s
characters.description: Appears in The Crystalling - Part 1 and The Crystalling - Part 2 as a witness to Flurry Heart's Crystalling. Has speaking roles in The Crystalling - Part 1 and The Times They Are A Changeling. Voiced by Andrew Francis in the former, and Ian Hanlin in the latter. Also appears in It Isn't the Mane Thing About You, Uncommon Bond, The Beginning of the End - Part 1, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 9. His cutie mark is an ornamental vase. He is a character called "Orange Crystal Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Golden Wheat
characters.description: One of the cleaning Crystal Ponies who appear in Games Ponies Play. Also appears in The Crystalling - Part 1 and The Crystalling - Part 2. Her cutie mark is a grain of wheat. She is named on her Enterplay collectible card game The Crystal Games expansion set card #84 C, which gives her the description "Golden Wheat put just as much effort into cleaning the city before the Equestria Games as she does caring for her little animal friends throughout the Crystal Empire."

characters.name: Honeysparkle
characters.description: One of the stylist Crystal Ponies who appear in Games Ponies Play. Has a speaking role in The Times They Are A Changeling. Also appears in the season 3 poster. She resembles Sweetie Drops in color scheme. Her cutie mark is a pair of combs. She is named "Honeysparkle" in the twenty-third wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards. She was first named "Glamour Gleam" on her Enterplay collectible card game The Crystal Games expansion set card #64 U, which lists the quote "You'll feel MUCH better after you exfoliate, darling, trust me." She is a character named "Glamour Gleam" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name:
Ivory Crystal Pony
Ivory Rook
characters.description: Ivory Rook is a Crystal Earth pony stallion with a light yellow coat, blue mane and tail, light blue eyes, and a cutie mark of a crenelated tower. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise.

characters.name: Jade
characters.description: A Crystal Pony who appears in The Crystal Empire - Part 2. Her cutie mark is a fleur-de-lis.

characters.name: Jaded Jasper
characters.description: A Crystal Pony who appears in The Crystal Empire - Part 2. His cutie mark is a crenelated tower.

characters.name: Lilac Luster
characters.description: One of the stylist Crystal Ponies who appear in Games Ponies Play. Also appears in the season 3 poster. She resembles Daisy in color scheme. Her cutie mark is two flowers and a bow. She is named in the twenty-second wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards. The collector card states about Lilac Luster, "She loves shiny, happy friends." She was first named on her Enterplay collectible card game The Crystal Games expansion set card #66 C, which gives her the description "Lilac Luster's personal motto is that the better you take care of yourself, the better you take care of others." She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name:
Mustache Crystal Pony
Mustafa Combe
characters.description: Appears in The Crystalling - Part 2 as a witness to Flurry Heart's Crystalling. Also appears in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 9. Has the same body type as Trenderhoof, "Free Throw", "Natural Deduction", "Uptown Clover", and S06E17 Unnamed Earth Stallion #6 and a similar body type to "Sprig Hooffield", S07E10 Unnamed Earth Stallion #4, and Chancellor Neighsay. His cutie mark is a mustache and comb. Voiced by Russell Roberts. He is a character called "Mustache Crystal Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Neighls Bohr
characters.description: A freckled Crystal Pony who appears in Equestria Games with a speaking role. Also appears in The Crystalling - Part 1, in The Crystalling - Part 2, in The Times They Are A Changeling, in Fame and Misfortune, in Uncommon Bond, in The Beginning of the End - Part 1, in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 9, and on the season 4 poster. Voiced by Ashleigh Ball.

characters.name: Night Knight
characters.description: Night Knight is the placeholder name of a Crystal Earth pony stallion with a blue coat, light blue mane and tail, amber eyes, and a cutie mark of a bow and arrow. He has a speaking role in the episode The Crystal Empire - Part 1.

characters.name: Periwinkle Pace
characters.description: A Crystal Pony athlete who appears in Games Ponies Play. In the book Winning Style, he appears alongside "Rapid Rush" and "Toastie" on page 8 and is set to win the race on page 9. He is named on his Enterplay collectible card game The Crystal Games expansion set card #11 C, which lists the quote "I won the Crystal Empire Jump Rope Championships before most ponies in Equestria were born! So when I tell you that you should stretch before you exercise, you better believe I know what I'm talking about."

characters.name: Purple Polish
characters.description: A Crystal Pony who appears in The Crystal Empire - Part 2 and cleaning in Games Ponies Play.

characters.name: Rapid Rush
characters.description: A Crystal Pony athlete who appears in Games Ponies Play. In the book Winning Style, she appears alongside "Toastie" and Periwinkle Pace on page 8 and is set to lose the race on page 9.

characters.name: Rooks Rampart
characters.description: A Crystal Pony who appears in the Crystal Empire in The Crystal Empire - Part 2, Games Ponies Play, The Crystalling - Part 1, The Crystalling - Part 2, and The Times They Are A Changeling, and in Canterlot in Magical Mystery Cure. Also appears in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 9. His cutie mark is a crenelated tower. He is named "Rooks Rampart" in the twenty-second wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards. The collector card states about Rooks Rampart, "A friendly game is his favorite thing." He was first named "Rook Ramparts" on his Enterplay collectible card game The Crystal Games expansion set card #55 C, which attributes to him and Pinkie Pie the respective quotes "Knight to queen's bishop 3." and "Go fish!"

characters.name: Rose Quartz
characters.description: One of the stylist Crystal Ponies who appear in Games Ponies Play. Also appears in The Crystalling - Part 1 and the season 3 poster.

characters.name: Rubinstein
characters.description: Rubinstein is the placeholder name of a Crystal Earth pony stallion with a purple coat, light blue mane and tail, deep blue eyes, and a cutie mark of a crenelated tower.

characters.name: Sand Arrow
characters.description: A Crystal Pony who appears in The Crystal Empire - Part 1. His cutie mark is an archer's bow and arrow.

characters.name: Sapphire Joy
characters.description: Sapphire Joy is a Crystal Earth pony mare with a light purple coat, golden mane and tail, purple eyes, and a cutie mark of a plant growth. She has a speaking role in the episodes The Crystal Empire - Part 2 and The Times They Are A Changeling and in the magazine comic The Quest for the Lost Toy! She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise.

characters.name: Sapphire Rose
characters.description: A Crystal Pony who appears in The Crystal Empire - Part 2 and Games Ponies Play. Her cutie mark appears to be a grain of wheat.

characters.name:
Yellow Crystal Pony
Scarlet Heart
characters.description: Appears in The Crystalling - Part 1 and The Crystalling - Part 2 as a witness to Flurry Heart's Crystalling. Has speaking roles in The Crystalling - Part 1 and The Times They Are A Changeling. She is voiced by Nicole Oliver in the former and Iris Quinn in the latter. Also appears in A Royal Problem, It Isn't the Mane Thing About You, Uncommon Bond, The Beginning of the End - Part 1, The Ending of the End - Part 2, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 9. Her cutie mark is three red hearts. She is a character called "Yellow Crystal Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name:
Pin Pony
Scouts Honor
characters.description: Appears in The Crystalling - Part 2 as a witness to Flurry Heart's Crystalling. Also appears in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 9. His cutie mark is three safety pins. Voiced by Ian Hanlin. He is a character called "Pin Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name:
Green Crystal Pony
Silver Medal
characters.description: Appears in The Crystalling - Part 1 and The Crystalling - Part 2 as a witness to Flurry Heart's Crystalling. Also appears in The Times They Are A Changeling, It Isn't the Mane Thing About You, Uncommon Bond, The Beginning of the End - Part 1, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 9. His cutie mark is a trophy-like object. He is a character called "Green Crystal Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Sugar Glass
characters.description: A food stand Crystal Pony who appears in Games Ponies Play. Also appears in The Crystalling - Part 1, The Crystalling - Part 2, Uncommon Bond, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 9, and the season 3 poster.

characters.name: Sunshine Splash
characters.description: A Crystal Pony athlete who appears in Games Ponies Play.

characters.name: Take Off
characters.description: Appears in The Crystalling - Part 1 at the Crystal Empire train station. His cutie mark is a paper airplane.

characters.name: Toastie
characters.description: A Crystal Pony athlete who appears in Games Ponies Play. Also appears in The Crystalling - Part 1 and The Crystalling - Part 2. In the book Winning Style, she appears alongside "Rapid Rush" and Periwinkle Pace on page 8 and is set to lose the race on page 9.

characters.name: Verity Lucky
characters.description: Appears in The Crystalling - Part 1 when Flurry Heart demonstrates her uncontrollable magic. Has a similar color scheme to Gloriosa Daisy but specified by Jim Miller to be a different character.

characters.name: Winnow Wind
characters.description: A Crystal Pony who appears in The Crystal Empire - Part 2. Also appears in a photograph in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 5. Her cutie mark is a grain of wheat.

characters.name: Zirconic
characters.description: A Crystal Pony who appears in The Crystal Empire - Part 2 and Games Ponies Play.

characters.name: Pegasus Crystal Pony royal guards
characters.description: royal guards, some also referred to as the E.U.P. (Earth, Unicorn, Pegasus) Guard of the Protective Pony Platoons, are various groups of armored ponies, griffons, Hippogriffs, or gargoyles that serve various members of royalty. They act as bodyguards, ceremonial guards in festivities, soldiers, and chauffeurs on several occasions. The guards are generally shown wearing extremely serious expressions and usually don't speak, but when they do, their voice is provided by Jayson Thiessen, Andrew Francis, Peter New, Ian Hanlin, Brian Drummond, Jason Simpson and/or Scott Underwood. Their cutie marks are obscured by their uniforms.

characters.name:
Librarian
Amethyst Maresbury
characters.description: Amethyst Maresbury is an elderly female Crystal Earth pony with a light lilac coat, pink mane and tail, purple eyes, and a cutie mark of a scroll. She is the librarian of the Crystal Empire's non-castle library. She has a speaking role in the episode The Crystal Empire - Part 1, in the IDW comics' My Little Pony: Nightmare Knights Issue #2, and in the magazine comic Figle małej księżniczki/Babysitter-Boogie. She is unnamed in the show, only being referred to as "Librarian" in the ending credits of the aforementioned episode, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name:
Stubborn Crystal Pony
Tough Nut
characters.description: Appears in The Crystalling - Part 2 as a witness to Flurry Heart's Crystalling. Also appears in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 9. Shares her body type with Amethyst Maresbury and "Booksmart". Her cutie mark is a mule. Voiced by Andrea Libman. She is a character called "Stubborn Crystal Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name:
Violet Crystal Foal
Cherry Quartz
characters.description: Appears in The Crystalling - Part 1 as one of Spike's fans. Also appears in Uncommon Bond. He is a character called "Violet Crystal Foal" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name:
Pink Crystal Foal
Cloudy Spinel
characters.description: Appears in The Crystalling - Part 1 as one of Spike's fans. Also appears in Uncommon Bond. She is a character called "Pink Crystal Foal" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name:
Chiffon Crystal Foal
Coral Shores
characters.description: Appears in The Crystalling - Part 1 as one of Spike's fans. Also appears in Uncommon Bond and The Beginning of the End - Part 1. She is a character called "Chiffon Crystal Foal" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "A Spike superfan if there ever was one -- she just thinks that dragon is oodles of fun!"

characters.name:
White Crystal Foal
Frosty Quartz
characters.description: Appears in The Crystalling - Part 2 evacuating the Crystal Empire. Also appears in It Isn't the Mane Thing About You and The Beginning of the End - Part 1. He is a character called "White Crystal Foal" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Glass Slipper
characters.description: One of two Crystal Pony fillies featured in The Crystal Empire - Part 1, only shown in Princess Celestia's projection of the Crystal Empire prior to King Sombra's rule. Also appears in Games Ponies Play, Twilight's Kingdom - Part 1, The Crystalling - Part 1, and the season 3 poster in the present-day Crystal Empire. She has no cutie mark.

characters.name: Hope
characters.description: One of two Crystal Pony fillies featured in both Games Ponies Play and Twilight's Kingdom - Part 1, in the present-day Crystal Empire. Has a similar color scheme to "Titania". She has no cutie mark.

characters.name: Opal Bloom
characters.description: One of two Crystal Pony fillies featured in The Crystal Empire - Part 1, only shown in Princess Celestia's projection of the Crystal Empire prior to King Sombra's rule. Shares Apple Bloom's character design and hair bow design. Her cutie mark is a grain of wheat.

characters.name:
Aqua Crystal Foal
Rock Candy
characters.description: Appears in The Crystalling - Part 1 as one of Spike's fans. Also appears in The Beginning of the End - Part 1. She is a character called "Aqua Crystal Foal" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "This foal sure is friendly and quite quick to laugh (and is seriously jonesing for Spike's autograph)."

characters.name:
Blue Crystal Foal
Tiny Topaz
characters.description: Appears in The Crystalling - Part 1 as one of Spike's fans. He is a character called "Blue Crystal Foal" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Amethyst Star
characters.description: Amethyst Star is a female unicorn with a pink coat, a violet mane and tail with a floral lavender streak, amethyst eyes, and a cutie mark of three brilliant-cut diamonds. She shares her design with Lyra Heartstrings, Diamond Mint, and Lemony Gem, shares her mane and tail style with Rose and Silverspeed, and shares her tail style with Royal Ribbon. She has speaking roles in The Mysterious Mare Do Well, Slice of Life, and the German version of The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000.

characters.name: Apple Cobbler
characters.description: Apple Cobbler is a background Earth pony and a member of the Apple family who appears commonly throughout the series, often alongside other members of the Apple family. She has a toffee colored coat, a yellow mane (with an extra shade of yellow in her tail), and light blue eyes. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media. She shares her design with Red Gala, "Magdalena", and "Sundowner", and shares her design and eye color with S06E04 Unnamed Earth Mare #2.

characters.name: Applejack
characters.description: Applejack is a female Earth pony and one of the main characters of My Little Pony Friendship is Magic. She lives and works at Sweet Apple Acres with her grandmother Granny Smith, her older brother Big McIntosh, her younger sister Apple Bloom, and her dog Winona. She represents the element of honesty.

characters.name: Berryshine
characters.description: Berryshine, or Berry Punch, is a female Earth pony with a web color plum coat, raspberry pink mane and tail, fandango eyes, and a cutie mark of a bunch of grapes and a strawberry. Lauren Faust privately named the character "Pinot Noir" after her favorite wine, but the character was later explicitly named "Berryshine" and "Berry Punch" in different merchandise and games. Berryshine shares her design with Cherry Berry. She has a speaking role in It Isn't the Mane Thing About You, the chapter book Rainbow Dash and the Daring Do Double Dare, and in the IDW comics' My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #23.

characters.name: Caramel
characters.description: Caramel is a background male Earth pony in My Little Pony Friendship is Magic. He has a light brown coat with a darker brown mane. He shares his mane and tail style and his color scheme with Doctor Horse, and shares his design with Cherry Fizzy, Royal Riff, and S01E02 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1. He is called Chance-A-Lot in some merchandise.

characters.name: Charm
characters.description: Charm is the placeholder name of a female unicorn with a lavender coat, violet mane and tail, and fuchsia pink eyes. Her cutie mark is unknown.

characters.name: Cherry Berry
characters.description: Cherry Berry is a female Earth pony with a hot pink coat, Naples yellow mane and tail, purple eyes, and a cutie mark of a pair of cherries. She is unnamed on the show, only being referred to as "Girl Pony" in the credits of the episode Princess Twilight Sparkle - Part 2, but she is named in merchandise and other media. She shares her design with Berryshine. She has speaking roles in Luna Eclipsed, The Mysterious Mare Do Well, The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000, Putting Your Hoof Down, and Princess Twilight Sparkle - Part 2. Her design is similar to the G1 pony Crunch Berry, named Cherry Berry in the United Kingdom.

characters.name: Cloud Kicker
characters.description: Cloud Kicker is a female Pegasus pony with a lavender blue coat, jasmine mane and tail with a lemon chiffon streak, orchid eyes and a cutie mark of a cloud covering a sun. She shares her design with Merry May, shares her mane style with Lily Valley, and bears a resemblance to "Cloudy Kicks", "Lavender Lace", and Lily Blossom. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Crusoe Palm
characters.description: Crusoe Palm, also called Coco Crusoe or Coconut, is a male background Earth pony who appears in multiple episodes throughout the show. He has a brown coat, light yellow mane, purple eyes, and a cutie mark of a coconut or palm tree on a desert island. He is not named in the show, but he is named "Crusoe Palm" directly with a trademark symbol in first-party merchandise, "Coco Crusoe" directly sometimes with a trademark symbol in second-party merchandise and other media, and "Coconut" indirectly in another depiction.

characters.name: Dr. Hooves
characters.description: Dr. Hooves, or Whooves, also known as Dr. Whooves or Time Turner, is a background male Earth pony with an hourglass cutie mark. He shares his design with Meadow Song and Lucky Clover. Hasbro acknowledged the character's popularity in the Comic Con 2011 promotional poster, where he is explicitly posed in a way that his cutie mark is clearly visible.

characters.name: Eclair CrÃ¨me
characters.description: Eclair Crème is a female background Earth pony with a blue coat, pale yellow mane and tail, magenta eyes, and a cutie mark of two linked horseshoes. She has a speaking role in the episode For Whom the Sweetie Belle Toils. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Fine Line
characters.description: Fine Line is a female background unicorn pony with a light yellow coat, brown mane and tail, and blue eyes. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Flurry Heart
characters.description: Flurry Heart, also called Baby Flurry Heart[1] or Princess Flurry Heart, is an Alicorn foal and the newborn daughter of Princess Cadance and Shining Armor. She is first indirectly mentioned in the season five episode The One Where Pinkie Pie Knows, and she makes her physical debut in the season six premiere.

characters.name: Fluttershy
characters.description: Fluttershy is a female Pegasus pony and one of the main characters of My Little Pony Friendship is Magic. She lives in a small cottage near the Everfree Forest and takes care of animals, the most prominent of her charges being Angel the bunny. She represents the element of kindness.

characters.name: Gala Appleby
characters.description: Gala Appleby is a female Earth pony and a member of the Apple family. She has a yellow coat, salmon pink mane and tail, green eyes, and a cutie mark of three apple slices. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media. She has a speaking role in Green Isn't Your Color.

characters.name: Golden Harvest
characters.description: Golden Harvest, or Carrot Top, is a female Earth pony with a pale goldenrod coat, carrot orange mane and tail, dark olive green eyes, and a cutie mark of three carrots with greens. Her name is not mentioned on the show, but it appears varyingly in merchandise and other media. She has speaking roles in Boast Busters, Swarm of the Century, Green Isn't Your Color, A Friend in Deed, and It Isn't the Mane Thing About You.

characters.name: Goldengrape
characters.description: Goldengrape is a male background Earth pony with a light yellow coat, blue mane and eyes, and a cutie mark of two bunches of green grapes. His name is not mentioned in the show, and it first appeared in the accompanying pamphlet of a mystery pack toy released in January 2012. He is identical to Red Delicious apart from his cutie mark, and shares his design with Noteworthy and Coco Crusoe.

characters.name: Lemon Hearts
characters.description: Lemon Hearts is a female unicorn pony with a yellow coat, a cerulean mane and tail with a lighter tail streak, raspberry eyes, and a cutie mark of three hearts; two light blue and one light green. She has speaking roles in several episodes, beginning with Green Isn't Your Color, and in the IDW comics and chapter books.

characters.name: Lucky Clover
characters.description: Lucky Clover, or Shamrock, is a male background Earth pony with a light gray coat, dark gray mane, and light blue eyes. His cutie mark, three four-leaf clovers, resembles that of a female G1 pony named Clover. He first appears in Winter Wrap Up, and has speaking roles in The Best Night Ever and A Canterlot Wedding - Part 1. The show does not name him, but he receives his name from merchandise, other media, and promotional material. Lucky Clover also shares his design with Dr. Hooves and Meadow Song, and shares his mane and tail style with Crescent Moon and Buddy.

characters.name: Masquerade
characters.description: Masquerade is the placeholder name of a female background Earth pony with a light yellow coat, royal blue mane and tail, green eyes, and a cutie mark of a pink six-pointed star surrounded by five smaller white stars.

characters.name: Minuette
characters.description: Minuette is a female unicorn pony with a Maya blue coat, periwinkle mane and tail with a pigment blue streak, dark blue eyes, and a cutie mark of an hourglass. She has speaking roles in several episodes, beginning with A Canterlot Wedding - Part 1, and in the IDW comics and chapter books.

characters.name: Noteworthy
characters.description: Noteworthy is an Earth background pony with a light blue coat, a darker blue mane, amber eyes, and a cutie mark of two pairs of sometimes-backwards-facing quavers (eighth notes). His name is not mentioned in the show, but he is named in merchandise and other media. He shares his design with Goldengrape and Crusoe Palm.

characters.name: Orange Swirl
characters.description: Orange Swirl, or Dizzy Twister, is a female Pegasus pony with a light khaki coat, a pink mane and tail with a light pink streak, fuchsia rose eyes, and a cutie mark of three tornadoes. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise. She is identical to Sugar Twist apart from her mane colors, and shares her design with Rainbowshine. She has speaking roles in Lesson Zero and in Rainbow Falls.

characters.name: Perfect Pace
characters.description: Perfect Pace is a male background Earth pony with a blue coat, bright orange mane and tail, golden brown eyes, and a cutie mark of an hourglass. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Perfect Pie
characters.description: Perfect Pie, or Apple Pie, is a female Earth pony in the Apple family. She has a cream caramel coat, two-toned green mane and tail, light caramel eyes, and a cutie mark of three apple pies. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Pinkie Pie
characters.description: Pinkie Pie, full name Pinkamena Diane Pie, is a female Earth pony and one of the main characters of My Little Pony Friendship is Magic. She is an energetic and sociable baker at Sugarcube Corner, where she lives on the second floor with her toothless pet alligator Gummy, and she represents the element of laughter. Pinkie writes and performs many songs, and she is the source of many of the show's comical and cartoonish gags. She is called Ponka Po in some merchandise.

characters.name: Princess Cadance
characters.description: Princess Cadance, full name Princess Mi Amore Cadenza, is a Pegasus-turned-Alicorn pony who is first featured in the season two finale alongside her husband Shining Armor. She is Flurry Heart's mother, Twilight Sparkle's sister-in-law (after marrying Shining Armor) and former foal-sitter, Princess Celestia's adopted niece, and the co-ruler of the Crystal Empire alongside Shining Armor. She is also stated to be "a very distant relative" of Princess Amore, the former unicorn ruler of the Crystal Empire.

characters.name: Princess Celestia
characters.description: Princess Celestia, called Queen Celestia in one comic and early development, is an Alicorn pony, the former co-ruler of Equestria alongside her younger sister Princess Luna, and the adoptive aunt of Princess Cadance. In addition to her responsibility of raising the sun, she has also been the teacher of Twilight Sparkle and Sunset Shimmer at different periods in time, often addressing Twilight as "my faithful student" while mentoring her. She has a pet phoenix named Philomena.

characters.name: Princess Luna
characters.description: Princess Luna, known as Nightmare Moon or Night Mare Moon when transformed or under certain other circumstances, is an Alicorn pony, the younger sister of Princess Celestia, and the main antagonist of the season one premiere of My Little Pony Friendship is Magic as Nightmare Moon. She is also the adoptive aunt of Princess Cadance. Eventually, the Elements of Harmony restore Luna to her former self and she returns to rule over Equestria alongside her older sister. Princess Luna/Nightmare Moon is called by her respective early names Princess Selena/Night Mare in another depiction.

characters.name: Rainbow Dash
characters.description: Rainbow Dash is a female Pegasus pony and one of the main characters in My Little Pony Friendship is Magic. She maintains the weather and clears the skies in Ponyville. As a huge fan of the Wonderbolts, she becomes a reservist member of the elite flying group in Testing Testing 1, 2, 3 and a full member in Newbie Dash. In Sonic Rainboom, Rarity and Princess Celestia both declare that she is the best flier in all of Equestria. Rainbow Dash has a pet tortoise named Tank, whom she chooses out of Fluttershy's offered animals in the episode May the Best Pet Win! She represents the element of loyalty.

characters.name: Rainbowshine
characters.description: Rainbowshine is a female Pegasus pony with a wisteria coat, pink lace mane and tail with baby pink streaks, charm pink eyes, and a cutie mark of a rainbow. The show does not name her, but she receives her name from merchandise. She shares her design with Orange Swirl, and she has a similar color scheme to S01E14 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #5, "Swirly Cotton", "Rainbow Drop", "Northern Lights", "Amethyst Beat", S04E20 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #3, Sweetsong, Star Dasher, and Bright Bridle. She has brief speaking roles in Winter Wrap Up, Sonic Rainboom, Rainbow Falls, and Leap of Faith.

characters.name: Rarity
characters.description: Rarity is a female unicorn pony and one of the main characters of My Little Pony Friendship is Magic. She is Sweetie Belle's older sister and the subject of Spike's long-term crush. Rarity works as both a fashion designer and as a seamstress at her own shop in Ponyville, the Carousel Boutique. She has a white Persian cat named Opalescence. She represents the element of generosity.

characters.name: Red Gala
characters.description: Red Gala is a background Earth pony and a member of the Apple family who appears commonly throughout the series, often alongside other members of the Apple family. She has a light pink coat, a bright green mane (with an extra shade of green in her tail), and light green eyes. She shares her design with Apple Cobbler, shares her design, eye color, and cutie mark with "Sundowner", is identical to "Magdalena" in all but mane color, and also shares her design with S06E04 Unnamed Earth Mare #2. She is called Crimson Gala in some merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Rose
characters.description: Rose, or Roseluck, is a female Earth pony with a pale yellow coat, raspberry mane with light raspberry streaks, chartreuse green eyes, and a cutie mark of a rose. She has speaking roles in several episodes and other media.

characters.name: Royal Riff
characters.description: Royal Riff is a male Earth pony with a light purple coat, white mane and tail, orange eyes, and a cutie mark of two white G-clefs. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise and other media. He has a speaking role in Putting Your Hoof Down.

characters.name: Sassaflash
characters.description: Sassaflash, or Emerald Gem, is a female Pegasus pony with a pale turquoise coat, vanilla mane and tail, carrot orange eyes, and a cutie mark of two lightning bolts. She is not named in the show, however merchandise and other media respectively name her as Sassaflash with a trademark symbol and as Emerald Gem. She shares her design with Parasol. She has speaking lines in Testing Testing 1, 2, 3 and the chapter book Princess Cadance and the Spring Hearts Garden.

characters.name: Sea Swirl
characters.description: Sea Swirl is a female unicorn pony with a lilac coat, iris mane and tail with a light glaucous streak, raspberry rose eyes, and a cutie mark of two encircling dolphins; one light glaucous and one iris. Her name has not been used on the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media. She shares her design with Minuette and Peachy Pitt. Sea Swirl mouths the word "muffins" along with other ponies in Applebuck Season and has speaking roles in The Cutie Pox and Buckball Season.

characters.name: Shining Armor
characters.description: Shining Armor is a male unicorn pony, Twilight Velvet and Night Light's son, Twilight Sparkle's older brother, Princess Cadance's husband, and Flurry Heart's father. He is the former captain of the Canterlot Royal Guard, serving under Princess Celestia and Princess Luna, and bears the title of prince as a result of his marriage to Cadance. He first appears in the two-part season two finale alongside Cadance. In the season three premiere, he and Cadance are appointed as the rulers of the Crystal Empire.

characters.name: Shooting Star
characters.description: Shooting Star is a male background pony with a white coat, light blue mane, tail, and eyes, and a cutie mark of a dark blue Orion constellation. He is an Earth pony both in some in-show appearances and in merchandise, while he is a unicorn both in some in-show appearances and in other media. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Sir Pony Moore
characters.description: Sir Pony Moore is the placeholder name of a male background Earth pony with a bluish gray coat, dark gray mane and tail, blue eyes, and a cutie mark of three white stars.

characters.name: Sprinkle Medley
characters.description:
Sprinkle Medley, also named Spring Melody and April Showers, is a female Pegasus pony with a Celeste coat, Persian green mane and tail, baby blue eyes, and a cutie mark of a raining white cloud. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

Sprinkle has a speaking role in Rainbow Falls, in It Isn't the Mane Thing About You, and in the German version of The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000.

characters.name: Star Bright
characters.description: Star Bright is the placeholder name of a male unicorn with a gray coat, two-tone pale blue mane, amber eyes, and a cutie mark of a telescope.

characters.name: Starlight Glimmer
characters.description: Starlight Glimmer is a female unicorn pony and recurring character, initially an antagonist but later a protagonist, in the series. She first possibly appears in My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #14 and first explicitly appears in the season five premiere. From The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2 to Celestial Advice, she is Twilight Sparkle's student in the ways of friendship. As of A Horse Shoe-In, she is the principal of the School of Friendship. She is called Starlight Shimmer in some other media.

characters.name: Sunburst
characters.description: Sunburst is a male unicorn pony, Starlight Glimmer's childhood friend, and royal crystaller to Flurry Heart. As of A Horse Shoe-In, he is the vice principal of the School of Friendship. He first appears as a colt in the past in The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 2, and he appears as a full-grown stallion in present day in the season six premiere.

characters.name: Twilight Sparkle
characters.description: Twilight Sparkle is the central main character of My Little Pony Friendship is Magic. She is a female unicorn pony who transforms into an Alicorn and becomes a princess in Magical Mystery Cure. She is also the daughter of Twilight Velvet and Night Light, the younger sister of Shining Armor, sister-in-law to Princess Cadance, and paternal aunt to Flurry Heart.

characters.name: Twilight Sparkle
characters.description: Twilight Sparkle is the central main character of My Little Pony Friendship is Magic. She is a female unicorn pony who transforms into an Alicorn and becomes a princess in Magical Mystery Cure. She is also the daughter of Twilight Velvet and Night Light, the younger sister of Shining Armor, sister-in-law to Princess Cadance, and paternal aunt to Flurry Heart.

characters.name: Twinkleshine
characters.description: Twinkleshine is a female unicorn pony with an ivory coat, curly pink mane and tail, electric blue eyes, and a cutie mark of three sparkly blue stars. She shares her design with Lemon Hearts, and shares her tail style with Daisy and Golden Harvest. She has speaking roles in Friendship is Magic, part 1, A Canterlot Wedding - Part 1, A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2, Amending Fences, and the IDW comics' story The Fall of Sunset Shimmer. Her design resembles that of G1 Moondancer, whose G4 counterpart Moon Dancer she mentions in her first speaking role.
